business.headline: Groww shares list 12% higher on debut: Hold or book profit now?Groww's market debut at Rs 112 marks a strong start for the fintech, but analysts say investors should book partial profits and hold the rest for long-term growth amid valuation risks.

Groww shares list at 14% premium, exceeds expectation on market debutThe stock opened at Rs 114 on the BSE and Rs 112 on the NSE, compared to its IPO price of Rs 100 per share, exceeding market expectations for a modest gain.

Tata Motors CV shares list at 28% premium after demerger at Rs 335Tata Motors' commercial vehicle arm listed with a strong premium, reflecting investor confidence in India's transport and infrastructure growth, and marking a major milestone in the company's value-unlocking journey.

Pine Labs IPO allotment out: Check status, listing date and expected gainsInvestors who have applied for the IPO can check their allotment status through the BSE website or via the registrar, Kfin Technologies Ltd.

Gold price at Rs 1.24 lakh, silver nears Rs 1.56 lakh: What's next?The rally in precious metals comes amid expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut next month, easing concerns around the prolonged US government shutdown and continued weakness in the dollar index.

Tenneco Clean Air IPO opens for bidding: Check price band, GMP before subscribingTenneco Clean Air IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 3,600 crore, entirely an offer for sale (OFS) of 9.07 crore shares. This means all proceeds will go to the selling shareholders, and the company will not receive any fresh capital from the issue.

Sensex, Nifty open higher on optimism over Bihar exit polls, US trade dealOptimism over a likely NDA victory in Bihar and hopes of an imminent India-US trade deal lifted investor sentiment, driving Sensex and Nifty higher even as caution lingered over FII activity.

Tata Motors CV Listing: Post-demerger details and what it means for investorsThe new entity, Tata Motors Ltd (CV), will be India's largest commercial vehicle manufacturer, with a wide portfolio spanning small cargo vehicles, medium and heavy commercial vehicles (M&HCVs), and buses.

Groww IPO listing: Shares to open strong on NSE, BSE? Check GMPGroww IPO opened on November 4 and closed on November 7, with the allotment finalised on November 10. Investors who applied can now check their allotment status on the BSE website or through the registrar, MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd.

Tata Trusts names Neville Tata, Bhaskar Bhat as new trustees: ReportNeville, 32, currently leads Trent's value fashion brand Zudio and serves on several other Tata Trust boards. Bhaskar Bhat, a former Titan managing director, is credited with driving the company's diversification and expansion during his tenure.

All-new Paytm app brings greater privacy, stronger security and control for usersReinforcing its commitment to being the safest UPI app in India, Paytm now prevents screen recording during UPI payments, adding a critical layer of security that protects users from potential fraud.

Gold stays firm amid wedding demand. Time to buy?Gold continues to shine, backed by festive demand and supportive global trends. But with prices already high, many are wondering if the rally still has room to run or if caution is the smarter bet.

Sensex, Nifty reverse early losses to end higher fuelled by IT and auto stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 335.97 points to close at 83,871.32, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 120.60 points to end at 25,694.95.

PhysicsWallah IPO: Is it a good bet or should investors skip the listing?PhysicsWallah IPO will remain open for bidding from November 11 to November 13, 2025, with the allotment to be finalised on November 14, 2025.

Equity inflows fall 19% in October despite market rise: AMFIAmong equity categories, most still managed to bring in money, but with mixed momentum. Flexicap funds remained the most sought-after option, collecting Rs 8,928 crore, a solid 27% rise month-on-month.

Warren Buffett signs off: Key takeaways from his final letter to shareholdersThe 95-year-old investor, who has led Berkshire for nearly six decades, announced he will no longer write the company's annual reports or address shareholders at the annual meeting.

Rs 80,000 crore lying unclaimed: Why families fail to access loved ones' savingsFamilies in India are losing track of their own inheritance. With Rs 80,000 crore unclaimed, financial advisers warn that the problem is not wealth creation, but the absence of clear records, nominations and open discussions at home.

Gold at Rs 1.25 lakh, Silver extends gains: Why are prices rising again?Gold prices surged to Rs 1.24 lakh and silver neared Rs 1.55 lakh amid easing U.S. shutdown worries and Fed rate-cut hopes. Should investors buy now or wait for dips?

Bajaj Finance share price crashes 8%: What's behind today's slide?Shares of Bajaj Finance crashed nearly 8% today after solid earnings were overshadowed by a trimmed growth outlook and rising asset stress.

Want better SIP returns? Follow the 10-7-10 mantra, says expertSIP investors often look for the magic formula to grow wealth faster. According to an expert, the 10-7-10 mantra may be the closest thing to one — a simple, disciplined approach that can potentially boost long-term returns.

entertainment.headline: Blackpink's Jennie joins Lorde and Foo Fighters as Mad Cool 2026 headliner Jennie of Blackpink will co-headline Madrid's Mad Cool Festival in July 2026, marking a milestone for K-pop representation at the event and sharing the stage with international artists including Lorde, Foo Fighters, and Florence + The Machine.

Delhi blast: After Dhurandhar event, Mika Singh cancels Delhi show Singer Mika Singh cancelled his Delhi show following the deadly car blast near the Red Fort metro station on November 10, which resulted in multiple casualties and prompted security measures.

Oscar-nominated actor Sally Kirkland dies at 84 after illness Oscar-nominated actor Sally Kirkland, best known for her performance in the 1987 film 'Anna', died at the age of 84 in Palm Springs. The veteran actor, who appeared in over 250 film and TV projects, was celebrated for her fearless performances and lifelong dedication to the craft.

Rashmika Mandanna protects fan from her bouncer outside Hyderabad cinema. Watch Actor Rashmika Mandanna recently stopped her bouncer from pushing a female fan during a crowd incident in Hyderabad. A video of her gesture has gone viral.

Farhan Akhtar reacts to Big B's nausikhiya remark, opens up on Lakshya set incident  Farhan Akhtar clarified that he never intended to "teach" Amitabh Bachchan acting during the 'Lakshya' shoot, saying his enthusiasm as a first-time director may have unintentionally hurt the veteran actor. The duo later resolved the misunderstanding, with Big B recalling the incident fondly on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'.

The Restless grace of Javed Akhtar: A poet who refuses to be at peace At 80, Javed Akhtar remains a poet in pursuit of truth, not perfection. In this intimate conversation with IndiaToday.in, he reflects on his creative restlessness and his journey from resisting poetry to living it.

Hrithik Roshan honours Zarine Khan's legacy, Sussanne gets emotional at prayer meet The family members and industry gathered to honour veteran actor Zarine Khan at her prayer meet. Hrithik Roshan, Sanjay Khan, and others gave emotional speeches to reflect Zarine's legacy.

The Girlfriend box office Day 5: Rashmika Mandanna's film earns Rs 8 crore Rashmika Mandanna's 'The Girlfriend' continues a steady box office run, crossing Rs 8 crore in five days. The Rahul Ravindran-directed drama has earned praise for its emotional storytelling and Rashmika's powerful performance.

Haq box office Day 5: Emraan Hashmi–Yami Gautam film crosses Rs 11 Crore mark Emraan Hashmi and Yami Gautam's 'Haq' continues a steady run at the box office, crossing Rs 11 crore in five days. The political drama has received positive word of mouth for its strong performances and social message.

Is Hailey Bieber hinting at baby No 2? Says she's much more prepared Hailey Bieber reflects on motherhood, support systems, and the possibility of having more children with husband Justin Bieber, sharing insights into her evolving outlook and preparations.
Actor Govinda falls unconscious at home, admitted to hospital Actor Govinda was admitted to hospital after fainting at his home on Tuesday night. His lawyer and friend reported that he is now stable.

Florence Pugh opens up about being asked to do 'inappropriate' acts during sex scenes Florence Pugh has shared her experiences of working with intimacy coordinators and directors in the film industry, highlighting both positive developments and ongoing challenges. In an interview, Pugh spoke about the evolving role of intimacy coordination on sets, noting the need for improvement and standardisation.

Did Timothee Chalamet dump Kylie Jenner? Fans say she was doing all the work Reports have emerged that Kylie Jenner and Timothee Chalamet have ended their relationship after two and a half years, with speculation rising due to Chalamet's absence from Kris Jenner's recent 70th birthday celebration at Jeff Bezos' Beverly Hills estate.

Jimmy Kimmel's longtime friend and bandleader Cleto Escobedo dies at 59 Cleto Escobedo III, leader of Cleto and the Cletones and Jimmy Kimmel's close friend since childhood, has died at 59. He was a central figure on 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!' since 2003.

Sabrina Carpenter to star in Alice in Wonderland-inspired musical at Universal Sabrina Carpenter is set to lead and produce a new musical inspired by 'Alice in Wonderland' at Universal Pictures, marking her first major studio feature since the critical and commercial success of her 2024 album. Lorene Scafaria will write and direct, with Carpenter's involvement following recent Grammy nominations.

Woody and Buzz vs. the tablet? Toy Story 5 trailer teases a digital disaster Disney and Pixar release the first look at 'Toy Story 5', revealing a new smart tablet character and the return of familiar voices ahead of the film's June 2026 premiere.

BB 19 Episode 79: Tanya Mittal calls Amaal Mallik shameless amid kitchen conflict Episode 79 of 'Bigg Boss 19' saw political warfare turn personal as Kunickaa Sadanand's all-female alliance clashed with Amaal Malik over bias. It culminated in a bitter kitchen confrontation with Tanya over basic house rules.

Iranian actor Homayoun Ershadi, from The Kite Runner, Taste of Cherry, dies at 78 Iranian actor Homayoun Ershadi from 'The Kite Runner' died at the age of 78. He had also acted in the Iranian film 'Taste of Cherry'.

South Korean pop icon HyunA collapses on-stage after reported weight loss South Korean pop icon HyunA collapsed during her live performance recently. The singer who had recently lost 10 kg in a month, sparked health concerns.

general news.headline: Live: Arrested J&K doctor conducted multiple recces near Red Fort, say sourcesRed Fort Blast Live Updates: A massive blast ripped through a Hyundai i20 near Gate No. 1 of Delhi's Red Fort Metro Station around 6:50 pm on Monday, killing ten people and leaving several others critically injured. The explosion occurred as the car halted at a red light, and agencies suspect it to be a planned terror attack, invoking the UAPA in the FIR. Forensic teams have collected 42 exhibits, including car parts and gas cylinder fragments, to determine the nature of explosives used. The NIA has formally taken over the probe as nationwide alerts remain in force. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

Dr Umar bought i20 car 11 days before Red Fort blast, went underground day afterAccording to sources, the i20 was purchased on October 29 and taken out immediately for a pollution certificate before being parked inside Al-Falah University in Faridabad.

Need to bring in talent, not many in US: Trump's rare defence of H-1B visaThe President's rare endorsement of the H-1B came less than two months after his administration hiked the annual fee for the visa programme to a whopping USD 100,000, sending shockwaves among the country's entire expat workforce, including Indians.

The math of how women voters beat men hollow in Bihar Assembly pollsIn the first phase of voting on November 6, 69.04 per cent of women voted compared to 61.56 per cent of men. In the second and final phase on Tuesday, women's voter turnout increased further to 74.03 per cent, while the men's voter turnout was only 64.1 per cent.

How Asim Munir is taking Pakistan Army to 7th-century ArabiaPakistani Army Chief Asim Munir is staging a silent coup by getting the Constitution amended. Amid consolidation of power, Munir, a Quran-e-Hafiz, is taking the Pakistani military to 7th-century Arabia by using terms like fitna and khawarij from early Islamic history. The indoctrination is such that the Pakistani military is making its battles a jihad for Islam.

Who is Dr Shaheen, professor-turned-Jaish recruiter arrested in terror module case?A former medical college lecturer from Lucknow, Dr Shaheen Shahid, now stands accused of heading the Indian wing of Jaish-e-Mohammed's women's outfit. She is among the several doctors arrested in a terror module case.
Actor Govinda falls unconscious at home, admitted to hospitalActor Govinda was admitted to hospital after fainting at his home on Tuesday night. His lawyer and friend reported that he is now stable.

Popular anti-obesity drug Wegovy prices slashed by 37% in IndiaNovo Nordisk has reduced the prices of Wegovy by 37%. The obesity pen's lowest dose of 0.25 mg will sell at Rs 10,850 for a monthly pack.

The Restless grace of Javed Akhtar: A poet who refuses to be at peaceAt 80, Javed Akhtar remains a poet in pursuit of truth, not perfection. In this intimate conversation with IndiaToday.in, he reflects on his creative restlessness and his journey from resisting poetry to living it.

NYC will turn into Mumbai: US real estate mogul slams Mamdani's rent freeze planSternlicht, the chairman and CEO of Starwood Capital Group, said Mamdani's proposal to freeze rents because tenants' incomes have stagnated will trigger a chain reaction of nonpayment and erode confidence in property ownership.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

Thalapathy's goodbye: What Jadeja's exit would mean for Chennai Super KingsIPL 2026 retention: Ravindra Jadeja has been part of CSK's soul. If the trade to Rajasthan Royals materialises, CSK will lose more than a spin-bowling all-rounder. They will lose a symbol of loyalty and big moments. For CSK, Sanju Samson's arrival would be a promise, and a test of reinvention.

Did Timothee Chalamet dump Kylie Jenner? Fans say she was doing all the workReports have emerged that Kylie Jenner and Timothee Chalamet have ended their relationship after two and a half years, with speculation rising due to Chalamet's absence from Kris Jenner's recent 70th birthday celebration at Jeff Bezos' Beverly Hills estate.

Pak warns Afghanistan after terror attacks: Will pay back in the same coinThe Defence Minister Khawaja Asif's warning comes amid heightened tensions following two major terrorist attacks in Pakistan over the past 48 hours, one at Cadet College Wana in South Waziristan and another in the heart of Islamabad.

Smog blankets Delhi-NCR as air quality remains severe for 2nd day in a rowThe city's air quality had already slipped into the 'severe' zone on Tuesday evening for the first time this season, with the overall AQI touching 428, marking the worst pollution levels recorded this year.

Red Fort blast intensity hints at use of military-grade explosives: Sources Live UpdatesThe attack was carried out by Mohammad Umar, the doctor-turned-suicide bomber linked to the Faridabad terror module that was busted just hours before Monday's explosion. During the raid, authorities recovered nearly 2,900 kg of bomb-making material, including ammonium nitrate.

The woman who made India's first anti-epilepsy drug and changed the face of chemistryAsima Chatterjee became India's first woman to earn a D.Sc. in chemistry, pioneering plant-based medicines. Her work bridged traditional Ayurveda and modern science, overcoming gender bias and inspiring future generations.

Scammers forge Nirmala Sitharaman's signature, dupe Pune woman of Rs 99 lakhCybercriminals used forged documents and impersonation to extort Rs 99 lakh from a Pune retiree. The scam highlights rising threats exploiting public trust in government agencies.

Pakistan PM jumps to blame India for Islamabad suicide blast that killed 12Within hours of the suicide blast in Islamabad in which 12 people were killed, Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif blamed India for it. He also alleged New Delhi's role in the attack on a cadet college in Wana on Monday, saying Afghan Taliban was acting as "India's proxy". Sharif's allegations came without any evidence.
Prashant Kishor farsh par as Bihar goes NDA's way, exit polls showPrashant Kishor may have captured curiosity, but he seemed to have failed to capture votes, a compilation of major pollsters showed.

AI to be taught in Class 3, how will it reshape childhood learning?In classrooms once filled with crayons, songs and storytelling, children may soon be learning about algorithms and machine learning. India's new plan to start AI lessons from Class 3 has opened a debate: can early AI education spark creativity, or will it speed up schooling at the cost of play and wonder?

J&K cleric who radicalised doctors linked to Faridabad module arrestedA former paramedical worker at the Government Medical College (GMC) in Srinagar, Ahmad - who also served as an imam in Nowgam - was allegedly involved in luring medical professionals toward radical ideologies, according to intelligence sources.

Video: China's Hongqi bridge collapses months after opening amid massive landslideA recently opened bridge in southwest China's Sichuan province collapsed after a massive landslide. The Hongqi Bridge, part of a national highway to Tibet, gave way, but no casualties were reported.
Delhi blast prime suspect Umar Nabi was fired for patient's death in J&KBefore Faridabad, Dr Umar Un Nabi worked in a Jammu and Kashmir hospital. And was terminated.

Oscar-nominated actor Sally Kirkland dies at 84 after illnessOscar-nominated actor Sally Kirkland, best known for her performance in the 1987 film 'Anna', died at the age of 84 in Palm Springs. The veteran actor, who appeared in over 250 film and TV projects, was celebrated for her fearless performances and lifelong dedication to the craft.

Rashmika Mandanna protects fan from her bouncer outside Hyderabad cinema. WatchActor Rashmika Mandanna recently stopped her bouncer from pushing a female fan during a crowd incident in Hyderabad. A video of her gesture has gone viral.

sports.headline: Can South Africa's spinners do a New Zealand to take down India in Kolkata? IND vs SA, 1st Test: South Africa have a strong spin attack, and they would fancy their chances when the series opener starts on November 14 at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

IPL 2026 Retentions: Will MI consider releasing Boult? Matthew Hayden responds Matthew Hayden feels that Mumbai Indians maybe tempted to release Trent Boult and then buy him for a lesser price during the IPL 2026 auction. Boult was key to MI's run to the play-offs last season.

Hazlewood suffers injury scare in Shield game ahead of Ashes opener: Report Australia's Test preparations took a hit after Josh Hazlewood and Sean Abbott left the field and didn't return for Day 3 of the Sheffield Shield clash at the SCG. The nature of the injuries of both players is yet to be determined, with the Australian medical team monitoring their conditions.

Asian Games medallist Manju Bala gets five-year doping ban, several others suspended Asian Games medallist Manju Bala has been handed a five-year ban by NADA after testing positive for banned substances.

Thalapathy's goodbye: What Jadeja's exit would mean for Chennai Super Kings IPL 2026 retention: Ravindra Jadeja has been part of CSK's soul. If the trade to Rajasthan Royals materialises, CSK will lose more than a spin-bowling all-rounder. They will lose a symbol of loyalty and big moments. For CSK, Sanju Samson's arrival would be a promise, and a test of reinvention.

Spain manager shocked by Yamal's surprise surgery and national team withdrawal Spain head coach Luis de la Fuente expressed surprise and dissatisfaction after learning Lamine Yamal underwent treatment without the national federation's awareness. The RFEF criticised the lack of communication, resulting in Yamal's withdrawal from Spain's squad for upcoming World Cup qualifiers.

Two-tier Test system unlikely as ICC plans 12-team WTC cycle in 2027: Report The proposed two-tier Test system is unlikely to move forward, as the ICC is reportedly planning for all 12 full member teams to participate in the WTC cycle in 2027. The ICC is also thinking about reviving the ODI Super League.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: Will KKR undergo major overhaul under Nayar?  After a disappointing title defence, KKR will be aiming for a massive overhaul under new coach Abhishek Nayar. Will the three-time champions look to rebuild a new core with Nayar at the helm?

Lionel Messi opens up on abrupt FC Barcelona departure: Really want to go back Lionel Messi has once again opened up about his deep-rooted love for FC Barcelona, admitting that he still misses the city and dreams of returning one day to live in Catalonia with his family.

Deepti Sharma on life after World Cup glory and women's cricket's rise: Feels surreal India's Women's World Cup hero Deepti Sharma opened up on how life has seen a sudden fame, which also marks the sport's new era. She shared how public recognition and the title win are reshaping her world and women's cricket.

Spain manager shocked by Yamal's surprise surgery and national team withdrawal Spain head coach Luis de la Fuente expressed surprise and dissatisfaction after learning Lamine Yamal underwent treatment without the national federation's awareness. The RFEF criticised the lack of communication, resulting in Yamal's withdrawal from Spain's squad for upcoming World Cup qualifiers.

Two-tier Test system unlikely as ICC plans 12-team WTC cycle in 2027: Report The proposed two-tier Test system is unlikely to move forward, as the ICC is reportedly planning for all 12 full member teams to participate in the WTC cycle in 2027. The ICC is also thinking about reviving the ODI Super League.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: Will KKR undergo major overhaul under Nayar?  After a disappointing title defence, KKR will be aiming for a massive overhaul under new coach Abhishek Nayar. Will the three-time champions look to rebuild a new core with Nayar at the helm?

Lionel Messi opens up on abrupt FC Barcelona departure: Really want to go back Lionel Messi has once again opened up about his deep-rooted love for FC Barcelona, admitting that he still misses the city and dreams of returning one day to live in Catalonia with his family.

Deepti Sharma on life after World Cup glory and women's cricket's rise: Feels surreal India's Women's World Cup hero Deepti Sharma opened up on how life has seen a sudden fame, which also marks the sport's new era. She shared how public recognition and the title win are reshaping her world and women's cricket.

Karnataka Nurtures Future Champions: 4th Mini Games Concludes With Over 5,000 Young Athletes.The 4th Mini Karnataka Games 2025, a week-long event for under-14 athletes, has concluded in Bengaluru. Organized by the Karnataka Olympic Association, the Department of Youth Empowerment and Sports, and the Sports Authority of Karnataka, the games featured over 5,000 participants competing in 27 sports. An official stated, 'Future of our country will be relying on our young children. At this age, if we groom and then if we make them to participate in state level and national level, then they will be our products for next Olympics and Asian Games and Commonwealth Games and international championships.' The state government has also announced cash prizes for national-level medalists and job reservations for sports achievers.

Venkatesh Prasad to run for Karnataka cricket president with Kumble, Srinath backingFormer India fast bowler Venkatesh Prasad announced his bid for the Karnataka State Cricket Association (KSCA) president's post. His panel received strong backing from legends Anil Kumble and Javagal Srinath ahead of the November 30 elections.

Sumit Nagal seeks Chinese embassy help after visa denied for Australia Open PlayoffIndia's top-ranked tennis player Sumit Nagal has urged Chinese authorities to review his visa rejection ahead of the Australian Open Asia-Pacific Playoff in Chengdu. The denial has cast doubt over his participation in the crucial event.

South Africa show attacking intent against spin in nets to prepare for Kolkata TestIND vs SA, 1st Test: Buoyed by their series-levelling win over Pakistan, South Africa began training in India with an aggressive focus on countering spin ahead of the opening Test starting Friday. With Temba Bavuma returning as captain, the Proteas looked upbeat in nets, though top-order consistency and selection reshuffles remain key concerns.

India asked for spin-friendly pitch at Eden Gardens, reveals Kolkata curatorIND vs SA, 1st Test: In an interview with India Today, Kolkata pitch curator Sujan Mukherjee discussed the nature of the Eden Gardens surface ahead of the series opener between India and South Africa on November 14, addressing whether the pitch will favour spin.

Two fans die due to cardiac arrest on second day of ATP Finals in TurinTwo spectators, aged 70 and 78, tragically died of cardiac arrests on the second day of the ATP Finals in Turin despite prompt medical intervention. The FITP and ATP paid condolences following the passing of two spectators.

Spin-friendly pitch? Eden curator reveals talk with coach Gambhir before 1st TestIndia vs South Africa: With India wary of rank turners after last year's 0-3 defeat to New Zealand, Eden Gardens curator Sujan Mukherjee has promised a sporting pitch for the opener. The surface is expected to offer bounce early and gradual turn later, keeping both pacers and spinners interested across five days.

India asked for spin-friendly pitch at Eden Gardens, reveals Kolkata curatorIND vs SA, 1st Test: In an interview with India Today, Kolkata pitch curator Sujan Mukherjee discussed the nature of the Eden Gardens surface ahead of the series opener between India and South Africa on November 14, addressing whether the pitch will favour spin.

Two fans die due to cardiac arrest on second day of ATP Finals in TurinTwo spectators, aged 70 and 78, tragically died of cardiac arrests on the second day of the ATP Finals in Turin despite prompt medical intervention. The FITP and ATP paid condolences following the passing of two spectators.

Spin-friendly pitch? Eden curator reveals talk with coach Gambhir before 1st TestIndia vs South Africa: With India wary of rank turners after last year's 0-3 defeat to New Zealand, Eden Gardens curator Sujan Mukherjee has promised a sporting pitch for the opener. The surface is expected to offer bounce early and gradual turn later, keeping both pacers and spinners interested across five days.

800 days and counting: Babar Azam equals Virat Kohli as wait for century prolongsBabar Azam's century drought stretched to 800 days as he was dismissed for 29 in the ODI series opener against Sri Lanka. The Pakistan skipper showed flashes of class early on but was ultimately outfoxed, leaving his wait for a hundred to continue after 83 innings.

Lionel Messi to visit Hyderabad in December: Telanagan CM confirms with new posterLionel Messi will visit Hyderabad on December 13, 2025, as part of his 'GOAT Tour to India 2025'. Telangana CM Revanth Reddy confirmed the news by unveiling an official poster announcing the football legend's arrival.

IPL 2026 auction to be held in Abu Dhabi on 15 or 16th December: SourcesThe Indian Premier League (IPL) auction is heading back to the Gulf, with Abu Dhabi set to host the upcoming IPL 2026 mini-auction in mid-December, sources told India Today.

Bangladesh bounce back to stifle Ireland with spinners in Sylhet TestBangladesh staged a strong comeback to restrict Ireland after the visitors made a promising start. Paul Stirling and debutant Cade Carmichael built a solid foundation, but Mehidy Hasan Miraz and Hasan Murad triggered a middle-order collapse.

Anvay Dravid, named in India U-19 B squad for Afghanistan tri-series in BengaluruAnvay Dravid, son of Rahul Dravid, has been named in India's Under-19 B squad for the upcoming tri-series in Bengaluru. He continues to rise up the ranks in youth-level cricket.

After quiet Aus tour, Shubman Gill sweats in optional session before Kolkata TestIndia vs South Africa: Captain Shubman Gill led from the front in an optional training session at Eden Gardens on Tuesday. The star batter spent 90 minutes in the nets, taking on both spin and pace in the lead-up to the series opener on 14 November.

Shaheen Shah Afridi: I became Pakistan captain only after Rizwan decided to resignPAK vs SL: Shaheen Shah Afridi revealed that he became Pakistan's ODI captain only after Mohammad Rizwan voluntarily stepped down from the role, following discussions between them and the PCB.

KKR should release overpriced Venkatesh Iyer, buy him for lower price: Aaron FinchAaron Finch believes Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) should part ways with Venkatesh Iyer ahead of the IPL 2026 auction, suggesting that the all-rounder's steep Rs 23.75 crore price tag no longer reflects his performances.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
